intro: Brittenia subacaulis, commonly known as the slender Brittenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Brittenia subacaulis is often found in moist, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
